DataElement.preferredName: Serum Ferritin Laboratory Procedure Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not a serum ferritin laboratory procedure was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed._An iron protein complex, containing up to 23 percent iron, formed by the union of ferric iron with apoferritin; it is found in the intestinal mucosa, spleen, bone marrow, reticulocytes, and liver, and regulates iron storage and transport from the intestinal lumen to plasma._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:An iron protein complex, containing up to 23% iron, formed by the union of ferric iron with apoferritin; it is found in the intestinal mucosa, spleen, bone marrow, reticulocytes, and liver, and regulates iron storage and transport from the intestinal lumen to plasma.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

An iron protein complex, containing up to 23% iron, formed by the union of ferric iron with apoferritin; it is found in the intestinal mucosa, spleen, bone marrow, reticulocytes, and liver, and regulates iron storage and transport from the intestinal lumen to plasma.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Angela, removed percent symbol from Ferritin definition
